contentExpanded.html: As part of the league-wide NBA Cares Season of Giving campaign, Golden State Warriors players, coaches, and front office staff will host a variety of events this holiday season to brighten the lives of local families and youth.
contentExpanded.text: As part of the league-wide NBA Cares Season of Giving campaign, Golden State Warriors players, coaches, and front office staff will host a variety of events this holiday season to brighten the lives of local families and youth.

contentExpanded.html: To tip-off Season of Giving, the Warriors, in partnership with Kaiser Permanente, The Athletes’ Corner, and the Gary Payton II Foundation, will host a Swishes for Dishes pop-up pantry for community members to pick up free turkeys and groceries on Saturday, November 22, at Greater St. John Missionary Baptist Church in Oakland.
contentExpanded.text: To tip-off Season of Giving, the Warriors, in partnership with Kaiser Permanente, The Athletes’ Corner, and the Gary Payton II Foundation, will host a Swishes for Dishes pop-up pantry for community members to pick up free turkeys and groceries on Saturday, November 22, at Greater St. John Missionary Baptist Church in Oakland.

contentExpanded.html: Additional upcoming Warriors Season of Giving events are listed below. This schedule is for planning purposes only and is not to be pre-promoted.
contentExpanded.text: Additional upcoming Warriors Season of Giving events are listed below. This schedule is for planning purposes only and is not to be pre-promoted.

contentExpanded.html: • Holiday Shopping Spree, presented by Waymo: On Saturday, November 22, the Warriors, in partnership with Waymo, will host a Holiday Shopping Spree at the San Francisco West Target, where families from the Bayview YMCA and Hamilton Families will have the opportunity to pick out gifts of their choice with help from former Warrior Festus Ezeli. Following the experience, families will be surprised with tickets to the Warriors vs. Oklahoma City Thunder game, presented by Waymo, on Tuesday, December 2.

• Hoopers & Holiday Treats, presented by ampm: On Tuesday, November 25, Warriors forward Gui Santos and guard Will Richard, along with Valkyries' bestie, Violet, will join youth from Mobilize Love at Golden State Shop for a dessert decorating experience followed by a shopping spree.

• Golden State Community Foundation Holiday Auction: The Golden State Community Foundation will host a Holiday Auction from Tuesday, December 2, to Tuesday, December 9, with an array of items including one-of-a-kind experiences, autographed memorabilia, and more, with all proceeds benefitting the Foundation’s annual grants program.

• San Francisco Generation Thrive Tree Giveaway: On Thursday, December 4, Kaiser Permanente's Generation Thrive will give a complimentary holiday tree, a box of ornaments, and lights to students and families of Willie Brown Middle School, the adopted school of the Golden State Community Foundation, in San Francisco, along with festive on-campus activities including a photo booth, visits from Santa, hot cocoa, and arcade games.

• Oakland Generation Thrive Tree Giveaway: On Tuesday, December 9, Kaiser Permanente's Generation Thrive will give a complimentary holiday tree, a box of ornaments, and lights to students and families of Martin Luther King, Jr. Elementary School, in Oakland, along with festive on-campus activities including a photo booth, visits from Santa, hot cocoa, and arcade games.
  • Holiday Market, presented by Pepsi: The Warriors, in partnership with Pepsi, will host a pop-up Holiday Market at Thrive City on Thursday, December 18, to provide community members with free grocery items that can be used to prepare a holiday meal.

• Kaiser Permanente  Hospital Visit: Patients at a Bay Area Kaiser Permanente hospital will receive Warriors-themed gift bags and a surprise visit from a Warriors player on Sunday, December 21.
  • PetMeds Surprise & Delight: On Sunday, December 21, in partnership with PetMeds, a Warriors player will surprise Muttville, a senior dog rescue, with adoption gifts to give out to families who are adopting pets during the holiday season.
• Christmas Day Gift Exchange: Prior to tipoff of the Warriors matchup against the Dallas Mavericks on Thursday, December 25, Bay Area youth will be surprised with holiday gifts.

Earlier this month, the Warriors hosted a Chop ‘N Chat at Generation Thrive Oakland, where Bay Area educators and nonprofit practitioners learned how to make a healthy, holiday-themed meal from former Warrior Festus Ezeli and celebrity chef Nikki Shaw.
contentExpanded.text: Earlier this month, the Warriors hosted a Chop ‘N Chat at Generation Thrive Oakland, where Bay Area educators and nonprofit practitioners learned how to make a healthy, holiday-themed meal from former Warrior Festus Ezeli and celebrity chef Nikki Shaw.

contentExpanded.html: The Warriors and Kaiser Permanente will also provide special Thrive City Winter Wonderland community hosting experiences for local nonprofit organizations that include a dedicated space to enjoy the events, food and beverage, transportation, gifts, and more.
contentExpanded.text: The Warriors and Kaiser Permanente will also provide special Thrive City Winter Wonderland community hosting experiences for local nonprofit organizations that include a dedicated space to enjoy the events, food and beverage, transportation, gifts, and more.

contentExpanded.html: The Golden State Warriors have announced activations for the team’s 2025 Emirates NBA Cup home games, also known as Warriors Cup Games, the first of which will take place Friday, November 21, against the Portland Trail Blazers at 7 p.m. Fans can purchase tickets for all Warriors Cup games at Chase Center by visiting warriors.com or by calling 1-888-GSW-HOOP.
contentExpanded.text: The Golden State Warriors have announced activations for the team’s 2025 Emirates NBA Cup home games, also known as Warriors Cup Games, the first of which will take place Friday, November 21, against the Portland Trail Blazers at 7 p.m. Fans can purchase tickets for all Warriors Cup games at Chase Center by visiting warriors.com or by calling 1-888-GSW-HOOP.

contentExpanded.html: Fans in attendance at each Warriors Cup game will enjoy a heightened in-game experience and will receive limited-edition giveaways. During tomorrow’s matchup against the Portland Trail Blazers, all fans in attendance will receive a custom Warriors Cup Games Shirt, courtesy of CarMax, while fans in attendance at the Warriors vs. Houston Rockets game on Wednesday, November 26, will receive a custom Warriors Cup Games Shirt, courtesy of Chase and PazeSM Online Checkout.
contentExpanded.text: Fans in attendance at each Warriors Cup game will enjoy a heightened in-game experience and will receive limited-edition giveaways. During tomorrow’s matchup against the Portland Trail Blazers, all fans in attendance will receive a custom Warriors Cup Games Shirt, courtesy of CarMax, while fans in attendance at the Warriors vs. Houston Rockets game on Wednesday, November 26, will receive a custom Warriors Cup Games Shirt, courtesy of Chase and PazeSM Online Checkout.

contentExpanded.html: All NBA Cup Group Play and Quarterfinals Games will be played on a court unique to every team. The Warriors court (pictured left) incorporates the statement edition uniform colors that the team will wear during those games and features the Cup trophy at center court and in the lanes.
contentExpanded.text: All NBA Cup Group Play and Quarterfinals Games will be played on a court unique to every team. The Warriors court (pictured left) incorporates the statement edition uniform colors that the team will wear during those games and features the Cup trophy at center court and in the lanes.

contentExpanded.html: To tip off the team’s NBA Cup games on the road, the Warriors lost to the Denver Nuggets, 129-104, on Friday, November 7, and defeated the San Antonio Spurs, 109-108, on Friday, November 14. With their 1-1 record in the NBA Cup, they tie the records of all teams in Western Conference Group C.
contentExpanded.text: To tip off the team’s NBA Cup games on the road, the Warriors lost to the Denver Nuggets, 129-104, on Friday, November 7, and defeated the San Antonio Spurs, 109-108, on Friday, November 14. With their 1-1 record in the NBA Cup, they tie the records of all teams in Western Conference Group C.

contentExpanded.html: Eight teams will advance to the Quarterfinals of the NBA Cup, with games played on Tuesday, December 9, and Wednesday, December 10. The winners of those games will advance to the Semifinals in Las Vegas. Each of the 22 teams that do not advance to the Quarterfinals of the NBA Cup will be assigned two regular season games (one home game and one away game) that will be played between December 11 and 15. For the official NBA Cup Information Guide, CLICK HERE.
contentExpanded.text: Eight teams will advance to the Quarterfinals of the NBA Cup, with games played on Tuesday, December 9, and Wednesday, December 10. The winners of those games will advance to the Semifinals in Las Vegas. Each of the 22 teams that do not advance to the Quarterfinals of the NBA Cup will be assigned two regular season games (one home game and one away game) that will be played between December 11 and 15. For the official NBA Cup Information Guide, CLICK HERE.

contentExpanded.html: The Warriors have adopted all-in pricing, which means the initial price displayed when browsing tickets is inclusive of all service fees, and no additional charges are added during the purchase flow. Warriors.com offers fans the only verified marketplace for Warriors tickets that is 100% guaranteed by the Warriors. In partnership with Chase Center Founding Partner Ticketmaster, the Warriors resale marketplace offers a safe and convenient way for fans to access all levels of tickets throughout the regular season and playoffs. SuiteXchange, a verified suite resale marketplace, is available for fans looking for single-game premium spaces at Chase Center for the 2025-26 season.

contentExpanded.html: The Golden State Warriors, without many key starters, fell 110-96 to the Miami Heat at Kaseya Center on Wednesday night.
contentExpanded.text: The Golden State Warriors, without many key starters, fell 110-96 to the Miami Heat at Kaseya Center on Wednesday night.

contentExpanded.html: Brandin Podziemski scored a team-high 20 points for the Warriors, while Quinten Post (19 PTS) and Buddy Hield (18 PTS) added 37 points off the bench. Pat Spencer recorded a near triple-double, recording 11 points, 13 assists and eight rebounds.
contentExpanded.text: Brandin Podziemski scored a team-high 20 points for the Warriors, while Quinten Post (19 PTS) and Buddy Hield (18 PTS) added 37 points off the bench. Pat Spencer recorded a near triple-double, recording 11 points, 13 assists and eight rebounds.

contentExpanded.html: Norman Powell led the Heat with 25 points on 10-for-14 shooting.
contentExpanded.text: Norman Powell led the Heat with 25 points on 10-for-14 shooting.

video.name: golden-state-warriors-highlights-vs-miami-heat-20251119
video.title: Highlights: Golden State Warriors vs. Miami Heat | 11/19/25
video.excerpt: Golden State Warriors Highlights vs. Miami Heat, 11/19/2025

contentExpanded.html:
SPENCER'S CAREER-NIGHT
Guard Pat Spencer filled up the box score on Wednesday, setting a career-high in rebounds and assists. Spencer, whose previous highs were six rebounds and five assists, recorded a near triple-double, scoring 11 points to go along with 13 assists and eight rebounds.
contentExpanded.text: SPENCER'S CAREER-NIGHTGuard Pat Spencer filled up the box score on Wednesday, setting a career-high in rebounds and assists. Spencer, whose previous highs were six rebounds and five assists, recorded a near triple-double, scoring 11 points to go along with 13 assists and eight rebounds.

contentExpanded.html: Spencer also finished with a team-high plus-10 differential.
contentExpanded.text: Spencer also finished with a team-high plus-10 differential.

video.name: pat-spencer-with-the-double-double-20251119
video.title: Highlights: Pat Spencer Records 11 Points, 13 Assists and Eight Rebounds | 11/19/25
video.excerpt: Pat Spencer with the double double, 11/19/2025

contentExpanded.html:
BUDDY'S BUCKETS
Buddy Hield recorded a season-high 18 points off the bench. Hield hit four 3-pointers on the night, and also recorded a season-high six rebounds.
contentExpanded.text: BUDDY'S BUCKETSBuddy Hield recorded a season-high 18 points off the bench. Hield hit four 3-pointers on the night, and also recorded a season-high six rebounds.

video.name: check-out-this-play-by-buddy-hield-9
video.title: Check out this play by Buddy Hield!
video.excerpt: Check out this play by Buddy Hield!, 11/19/2025

contentExpanded.html:
JACKSON-DAVIS AND SANTOS GET THE START
Trayce Jackson-Davis and Gui Santos entered the starting lineup on Wednesday night, the first start of the season for either player.
contentExpanded.text: JACKSON-DAVIS AND SANTOS GET THE STARTTrayce Jackson-Davis and Gui Santos entered the starting lineup on Wednesday night, the first start of the season for either player.

contentExpanded.html: It was the third career start for Santos, who recorded four and six rebounds in 18 minutes of action.
contentExpanded.text: It was the third career start for Santos, who recorded four and six rebounds in 18 minutes of action.

contentExpanded.html: Jackson-Davis recorded a season-high 11 rebounds, while tallying eight points on 2-for-2 shooting.
contentExpanded.text: Jackson-Davis recorded a season-high 11 rebounds, while tallying eight points on 2-for-2 shooting.

video.name: trayce-jackson-davis-rises-to-block-the-shot-4
video.title: Trayce Jackson-Davis rises to block the shot
video.excerpt: Trayce Jackson-Davis rises to block the shot, 11/19/2025

contentExpanded.html:
THIRD QUARTER RUN
The Warriors took their first lead of the game midway through the third quarter, and were able to take a two-point leading after three quarters of action. Quinten Post led the Warriors with 10 points in the quarter, shooting a perfect 4-for-4 from the field, including hitting two triples.
contentExpanded.text: THIRD QUARTER RUNThe Warriors took their first lead of the game midway through the third quarter, and were able to take a two-point leading after three quarters of action. Quinten Post led the Warriors with 10 points in the quarter, shooting a perfect 4-for-4 from the field, including hitting two triples.

video.name: what-a-shot-by-quinten-post-12
video.title: What a shot by Quinten Post
video.excerpt: What a shot by Quinten Post, 11/19/2025

contentExpanded.html:
SLOW START
The Warriors got off to a slow start on both ends of the court, missing their first 12 shots of the night and falling behind 20-4. Buddy Hield made the first field goal for the Dubs with 5:25 remaining in the first quarter. Hield recorded a team-high-tying five points in the opening frame as the Warriors were able to settle into the game and cut the deficit to single digits heading into the second quarter.
contentExpanded.text: SLOW STARTThe Warriors got off to a slow start on both ends of the court, missing their first 12 shots of the night and falling behind 20-4. Buddy Hield made the first field goal for the Dubs with 5:25 remaining in the first quarter. Hield recorded a team-high-tying five points in the opening frame as the Warriors were able to settle into the game and cut the deficit to single digits heading into the second quarter.

contentExpanded.html:
SHORTHANDED DUBS
The Warriors were without many rotational pieces on Wednesday, including Stephen Curry (ankle), Jimmy Butler III (back), Draymond Green (illness), Al Horford (toe) and Jonathan Kuminga (knee). De'Anthony Melton (knee) continued to remain out of the lineup, but was announced earlier Wednesday that he continues to make good progress with his rehabilitation and will be re-evaluated again in 10 days.
contentExpanded.text: SHORTHANDED DUBSThe Warriors were without many rotational pieces on Wednesday, including Stephen Curry (ankle), Jimmy Butler III (back), Draymond Green (illness), Al Horford (toe) and Jonathan Kuminga (knee). De'Anthony Melton (knee) continued to remain out of the lineup, but was announced earlier Wednesday that he continues to make good progress with his rehabilitation and will be re-evaluated again in 10 days.

contentExpanded.html:
SIX-GAME ROAD TRIP COMPLETED
The Warriors recent trip was tied for their longest road trip of the season (six games). The Dubs went 3-3 during the stretch, including a three-game winning stretch against the San Antonio Spurs twice and the New Orleans Pelicans, capped off by Stephen Curry's 95 total points against the Spurs.
contentExpanded.text: SIX-GAME ROAD TRIP COMPLETEDThe Warriors recent trip was tied for their longest road trip of the season (six games). The Dubs went 3-3 during the stretch, including a three-game winning stretch against the San Antonio Spurs twice and the New Orleans Pelicans, capped off by Stephen Curry's 95 total points against the Spurs.

contentExpanded.html:
UP NEXT 
The Warriors return home from their six-game road trip on Friday, when they host the Portland Trail Blazers (7 p.m.; NBCSBA) in an NBA Cup matchup. It will be the first of five consecutive games at Chase Center, as the team will then host the Utah Jazz (7 p.m.; NBCSBA) on Monday, Nov. 24, the Houston Rockets (7 p.m.; NBCSBA, ESPN) in their final Group Play game on Wednesday, Nov. 26, the New Orleans Pelicans (5:30 p.m.; NBCSBA, NBATV) on Saturday, Nov. 29 and the Oklahoma City Thunder (8 p.m.; NBCSBA, NBC, Peacock) on Dec. 2.
contentExpanded.text: UP NEXT The Warriors return home from their six-game road trip on Friday, when they host the Portland Trail Blazers (7 p.m.; NBCSBA) in an NBA Cup matchup. It will be the first of five consecutive games at Chase Center, as the team will then host the Utah Jazz (7 p.m.; NBCSBA) on Monday, Nov. 24, the Houston Rockets (7 p.m.; NBCSBA, ESPN) in their final Group Play game on Wednesday, Nov. 26, the New Orleans Pelicans (5:30 p.m.; NBCSBA, NBATV) on Saturday, Nov. 29 and the Oklahoma City Thunder (8 p.m.; NBCSBA, NBC, Peacock) on Dec. 2.

contentStructured.html: Spencer also finished with a team-high plus-10 differential.
contentStructured.text: Spencer also finished with a team-high plus-10 differential.

contentStructured.html:
BUDDY'S BUCKETS
Buddy Hield recorded a season-high 18 points off the bench. Hield hit four 3-pointers on the night, and also recorded a season-high six rebounds.
contentStructured.text: BUDDY'S BUCKETSBuddy Hield recorded a season-high 18 points off the bench. Hield hit four 3-pointers on the night, and also recorded a season-high six rebounds.

contentStructured.html:
JACKSON-DAVIS AND SANTOS GET THE START
Trayce Jackson-Davis and Gui Santos entered the starting lineup on Wednesday night, the first start of the season for either player.
contentStructured.text: JACKSON-DAVIS AND SANTOS GET THE STARTTrayce Jackson-Davis and Gui Santos entered the starting lineup on Wednesday night, the first start of the season for either player.

contentStructured.html: It was the third career start for Santos, who recorded four and six rebounds in 18 minutes of action.
contentStructured.text: It was the third career start for Santos, who recorded four and six rebounds in 18 minutes of action.

contentStructured.html: Jackson-Davis recorded a season-high 11 rebounds, while tallying eight points on 2-for-2 shooting.
contentStructured.text: Jackson-Davis recorded a season-high 11 rebounds, while tallying eight points on 2-for-2 shooting.

contentStructured.html:
THIRD QUARTER RUN
The Warriors took their first lead of the game midway through the third quarter, and were able to take a two-point leading after three quarters of action. Quinten Post led the Warriors with 10 points in the quarter, shooting a perfect 4-for-4 from the field, including hitting two triples.
contentStructured.text: THIRD QUARTER RUNThe Warriors took their first lead of the game midway through the third quarter, and were able to take a two-point leading after three quarters of action. Quinten Post led the Warriors with 10 points in the quarter, shooting a perfect 4-for-4 from the field, including hitting two triples.

contentStructured.html:
SLOW START
The Warriors got off to a slow start on both ends of the court, missing their first 12 shots of the night and falling behind 20-4. Buddy Hield made the first field goal for the Dubs with 5:25 remaining in the first quarter. Hield recorded a team-high-tying five points in the opening frame as the Warriors were able to settle into the game and cut the deficit to single digits heading into the second quarter.

Buddy Hield made the first field goal for the Dubs with 5:25 remaining in the first quarter. Hield recorded a team-high-tying five points in the opening frame as the Warriors were able to settle into the game and cut the deficit to single digits heading into the second quarter.

contentStructured.html:
SHORTHANDED DUBS
The Warriors were without many rotational pieces on Wednesday, including Stephen Curry (ankle), Jimmy Butler III (back), Draymond Green (illness), Al Horford (toe) and Jonathan Kuminga (knee). De'Anthony Melton (knee) continued to remain out of the lineup, but was announced earlier Wednesday that he continues to make good progress with his rehabilitation and will be re-evaluated again in 10 days.

De'Anthony Melton (knee) continued to remain out of the lineup, but was announced earlier Wednesday that he continues to make good progress with his rehabilitation and will be re-evaluated again in 10 days.

contentStructured.html:
SIX-GAME ROAD TRIP COMPLETED
The Warriors recent trip was tied for their longest road trip of the season (six games). The Dubs went 3-3 during the stretch, including a three-game winning stretch against the San Antonio Spurs twice and the New Orleans Pelicans, capped off by Stephen Curry's 95 total points against the Spurs.

The Dubs went 3-3 during the stretch, including a three-game winning stretch against the San Antonio Spurs twice and the New Orleans Pelicans, capped off by Stephen Curry's 95 total points against the Spurs.

contentStructured.html:
UP NEXT 
The Warriors return home from their six-game road trip on Friday, when they host the Portland Trail Blazers (7 p.m.; NBCSBA) in an NBA Cup matchup. It will be the first of five consecutive games at Chase Center, as the team will then host the Utah Jazz (7 p.m.; NBCSBA) on Monday, Nov. 24, the Houston Rockets (7 p.m.; NBCSBA, ESPN) in their final Group Play game on Wednesday, Nov. 26, the New Orleans Pelicans (5:30 p.m.; NBCSBA, NBATV) on Saturday, Nov. 29 and the Oklahoma City Thunder (8 p.m.; NBCSBA, NBC, Peacock) on Dec. 2.

items.excerpt: The Golden State Warriors, without many key starters, fell 110-96 to the Miami Heat at Kaseya Center on Wednesday night. Brandin Podziemski scored a team-high 20 points for the Warriors, while Quinten Post (19 PTS) and Buddy Hield (18 PTS) added 37 points off the bench. Pat Spencer recorded a near triple-double, recording 11 points, 13 assists and eight rebounds.

contentExpanded.html: Golden State Warriors guard De’Anthony Melton, who underwent surgery to repair a torn left ACL on December 4, 2024, continues to make good progress with his rehabilitation. He will continue to be integrated in full practice and various scrimmages with the Warriors. He will be re-evaluated again in 10 days.

contentExpanded.html: The Warriors will celebrate the 50th Anniversary of the 1975 NBA Championship team during their home game on Friday, November 21 versus the Portland Trail Blazers, the team announced Wednesday.
contentExpanded.text: The Warriors will celebrate the 50th Anniversary of the 1975 NBA Championship team during their home game on Friday, November 21 versus the Portland Trail Blazers, the team announced Wednesday.

contentExpanded.html: All living members of that Warriors team will be on hand for the celebration, including Rick Barry, Butch Beard, Charles Dudley, George Johnson, Jeff Mullins, Clifford Ray and Jamaal Wilkes. The late Alvin Attles will be represented by his son, Alvin Jr.
contentExpanded.text: All living members of that Warriors team will be on hand for the celebration, including Rick Barry, Butch Beard, Charles Dudley, George Johnson, Jeff Mullins, Clifford Ray and Jamaal Wilkes. The late Alvin Attles will be represented by his son, Alvin Jr.

contentExpanded.html: Throughout Friday night’s game, the Warriors will honor the 50th anniversary of the organization’s first West Coast championship in a variety of ways, including in-arena video features and a special on-court recognition. Additionally, the group will sign autographs inside the Golden State Shop from 5:50–6:25 p.m.
contentExpanded.text: Throughout Friday night’s game, the Warriors will honor the 50th anniversary of the organization’s first West Coast championship in a variety of ways, including in-arena video features and a special on-court recognition. Additionally, the group will sign autographs inside the Golden State Shop from 5:50–6:25 p.m.

contentExpanded.html: The 1974-75 season marked the Warriors’ 29th campaign in franchise history and 13th year in California. Golden State finished the regular season with a 48–34 record, capturing the Pacific Division title. Jamaal Wilkes earned NBA Rookie of the Year honors after averaging 14.2 points, 8.2 rebounds, 2.2 assists and 30.7 minutes while playing in all 82 games.
contentExpanded.text: The 1974-75 season marked the Warriors’ 29th campaign in franchise history and 13th year in California. Golden State finished the regular season with a 48–34 record, capturing the Pacific Division title. Jamaal Wilkes earned NBA Rookie of the Year honors after averaging 14.2 points, 8.2 rebounds, 2.2 assists and 30.7 minutes while playing in all 82 games.

contentExpanded.html: The Warriors advanced through the playoffs by defeating the Seattle SuperSonics in six games before rallying from a 3–2 deficit to beat the Chicago Bulls in seven in the Western Conference Finals. Golden State then swept the Washington Bullets (4-0) in the NBA Finals, earning the franchise’s first championship on the West Coast. Rick Barry was named Finals MVP after averaging 29.5 points, 4.0 rebounds, 5.0 assists, 3.50 steals and 43.0 minutes during those four games.

contentExpanded.html: The Warriors have won seven NBA championships: 1947, 1956, 1975, 2015, 2017, 2018 and 2022, the third-most in league history.

contentExpanded.html: The Golden State Warriors have announced a partnership with Sephora U.S., the world’s leading global prestige beauty retail brand, becoming the first Valkyries partner to join the Warriors portfolio. Sephora will become the official fragrance partner of the Warriors and Chase Center–spotlighting the growing men’s fragrance category–as well as the first-ever presenting beauty partner of the Warriors Dance Team.
contentExpanded.text: The Golden State Warriors have announced a partnership with Sephora U.S., the world’s leading global prestige beauty retail brand, becoming the first Valkyries partner to join the Warriors portfolio. Sephora will become the official fragrance partner of the Warriors and Chase Center–spotlighting the growing men’s fragrance category–as well as the first-ever presenting beauty partner of the Warriors Dance Team.

contentExpanded.html: Through the partnership, Sephora and the Warriors will create exclusive digital content, including a dedicated season-long social content series that will spotlight players and Warriors Dance Team members on game days. Sephora will receive prominent placement at Chase Center, visible on broadcast and in-arena, and introduce new in-arena game features. Fans will also have access to a Sephora kiosk during all Warriors home games and Chase Center events featuring a curated selection of beauty product offerings available for purchase. In addition, Warriors Dance Team members will receive Sephora gifting throughout the season.
contentExpanded.text: Through the partnership, Sephora and the Warriors will create exclusive digital content, including a dedicated season-long social content series that will spotlight players and Warriors Dance Team members on game days. Sephora will receive prominent placement at Chase Center, visible on broadcast and in-arena, and introduce new in-arena game features. Fans will also have access to a Sephora kiosk during all Warriors home games and Chase Center events featuring a curated selection of beauty product offerings available for purchase. In addition, Warriors Dance Team members will receive Sephora gifting throughout the season.

contentExpanded.html: “This partnership marks a significant milestone for the broader Golden State organization,” said Mike Kitts, Golden State Chief Commercial Officer. “Sephora becoming the first Valkyries partner to expand and align with the Warriors not only reflects the strength and growth of the Valkyries brand, but also the shared values across all of our teams. We look forward to this partnership enhancing the experience for our fans and partners across all of our properties.”
contentExpanded.text: “This partnership marks a significant milestone for the broader Golden State organization,” said Mike Kitts, Golden State Chief Commercial Officer. “Sephora becoming the first Valkyries partner to expand and align with the Warriors not only reflects the strength and growth of the Valkyries brand, but also the shared values across all of our teams. We look forward to this partnership enhancing the experience for our fans and partners across all of our properties.”

contentExpanded.html: “We’re thrilled to partner with the Golden State Warriors as their first official fragrance partner, which underscores the expanding opportunity within men’s fragrance, and highlights Sephora’s commitment to bringing best-in-class, inclusive beauty offerings to new audiences,” said Sephora U.S. Chief Marketing Officer Zena Arnold. “This collaboration reflects our commitment to redefining what beauty means, and gives us an incredible opportunity to engage with new audiences, including male fans who are increasingly embracing self-expression and categories like prestige fragrance. Alongside our successful partnership with the Valkyries, this partnership with the Warriors allows us to continue championing confidence, creativity, and community both on and off the court, in our shared Bay Area home.”
contentExpanded.text: “We’re thrilled to partner with the Golden State Warriors as their first official fragrance partner, which underscores the expanding opportunity within men’s fragrance, and highlights Sephora’s commitment to bringing best-in-class, inclusive beauty offerings to new audiences,” said Sephora U.S. Chief Marketing Officer Zena Arnold. “This collaboration reflects our commitment to redefining what beauty means, and gives us an incredible opportunity to engage with new audiences, including male fans who are increasingly embracing self-expression and categories like prestige fragrance. Alongside our successful partnership with the Valkyries, this partnership with the Warriors allows us to continue championing confidence, creativity, and community both on and off the court, in our shared Bay Area home.”

contentExpanded.html: As part of their founding partnership with the Valkyries, Sephora is the naming rights partner for the team’s 31,800 square-foot, state-of-the-art Oakland-based performance center, the “Sephora Performance Center.”
contentExpanded.text: As part of their founding partnership with the Valkyries, Sephora is the naming rights partner for the team’s 31,800 square-foot, state-of-the-art Oakland-based performance center, the “Sephora Performance Center.”

contentExpanded.html:
About Sephora
Sephora is the world’s leading global prestige beauty retail brand. With 50 000 passionate employees operating in 35 markets, Sephora connects customers and beauty brands within the world’s most trusted and dynamic beauty community. We serve a highly engaged community of hundreds of millions of beauty followers across our global omnichannel network of more than 3 200 stores and iconic flagships, and our e-commerce and digital platforms, offering personalized and immersive seamless experiences across every touchpoint. With our curation of close to 300 brands and our own label, Sephora Collection, we offer the most unique and diverse range of prestige beauty products, tailored to our customers’ needs from fragrance to make-up, haircare, skincare and beyond, as we constantly reimagine the world of prestige beauty. Since our inception in 1969 in Limoges, France, and as part of the LVMH Group since 1997, we have been disrupting the prestige beauty retail industry. Today, we continue to break with convention to drive our mission to expand the way the world sees beauty and empower the extraordinary in each of us.

contentExpanded.html: Stephen Curry scored 46 points as the Golden State Warriors defeated the San Antonio Spurs 125-20 at Frost Bank Center on Wednesday night. The Warriors knocked down a season-high 21 3-pointers in the victory.
contentExpanded.text: Stephen Curry scored 46 points as the Golden State Warriors defeated the San Antonio Spurs 125-20 at Frost Bank Center on Wednesday night. The Warriors knocked down a season-high 21 3-pointers in the victory.

contentExpanded.html: The Warriors trailed by as many as 16 points in the contest, but were able to take their first lead since 3-2 with just over five minutes left in the third quarter, and were able to hold an eight-point lead heading into the fourth frame. The Warriors outscored the Spurs 43-28 in the third quarter, led by Stephen Curry's 22-point quarter.
contentExpanded.text: The Warriors trailed by as many as 16 points in the contest, but were able to take their first lead since 3-2 with just over five minutes left in the third quarter, and were able to hold an eight-point lead heading into the fourth frame. The Warriors outscored the Spurs 43-28 in the third quarter, led by Stephen Curry's 22-point quarter.

contentExpanded.html: "That third quarter is what we do," Stephen Curry said postgame. "Getting stops. Pushing. Creating easy offense. Thankfully, I was able to knock a couple down."
contentExpanded.text: "That third quarter is what we do," Stephen Curry said postgame. "Getting stops. Pushing. Creating easy offense. Thankfully, I was able to knock a couple down."

contentExpanded.html: TEAM NOTABLES:
contentExpanded.text: TEAM NOTABLES:

contentExpanded.html:
• The Warriors improved to 7-6 on the season (2-6 on the road), snaping a six-game road losing streak and improving to 1-1 on the team’s current six-game road trip.
  • Golden State trailed by as many as 16 points in the win, the team’s largest comeback victory of the season and second double-digit comeback win of the year. 
  • Golden State scored a season-high 43 points in the third quarter, the team’s first 40-point quarter of the season, outscoring the Spurs 43-28 in the period. 
  • The Warriors have won nine of their last 12 games against the Spurs, including eight of the last nine in San Antonio. 
  • The Warriors concluded their fourth back-to-back set of the season, improving to 2-2 in the second game of a back-to-back. 
  • The Warriors became the first team in NBA history to win a game in which the opposing team had multiple players with triple-doubles, per the Elias Sports Bureau, as both Victor Wembanyama (31 points, 15 rebounds, 10 assists) and Stephon Castle (23 points, 10 rebounds, 10 assists) recorded triple-doubles for the Spurs. 
  • San Antonio lost its first home game of the season (5-1), marking the ninth time the Warriors have won a road game against an opponent that had won at least its first five home games.
    • The Warriors most recently did so on April 10, 2016, also against the Spurs, who had started the year 39-0 at home, giving Golden State an NBA-record-tying 72nd win of the season. 
  • Stephen Curry scored a season-high 46 points, his 73rd career 40-point game (second this season).
    • Curry scored 22 of his 46 points in the third quarter, his first 20-point quarter of the season (43rd career).
      • Of Curry’s 43 career 20-point quarters, 23 have come in the third quarter. 
    • Curry (23,657 career points) passed Alex English (23,613) for 23rd place on the NBA’s all-time scoring list. 
    • Curry now has now scored at least 40 points 43 times since turning 30 years old, which trails only Michael Jordan (44), and 12 times since turning 35, which equals Jordan and trails only LeBron James (15). 
  • Jimmy Butler III finished with 28 points, his eighth 20-point game of the season, to go with eight assists and six rebounds while hitting a season-high five 3-pointers (5-of-7 3FG). 
  • Moses Moody scored 19 points, hitting at least five 3-pointers for the fourth time this season (5-of-10 3FG). 
  • Al Horford scored nine points and grabbed three rebounds, passing Larry Bird (8,974 career rebounds) for 58th place on the NBA’s all-time rebounding list (8,977). 
  • Will Richard earned his second career start.

contentExpanded.html: Six Warriors scored in double figures as the Golden State Warriors defeated the Indiana Pacers 114-83 at Chase Center on Sunday night.
contentExpanded.text: Six Warriors scored in double figures as the Golden State Warriors defeated the Indiana Pacers 114-83 at Chase Center on Sunday night.

contentExpanded.html: The Warriors outscored the Pacers 39-18 in the fourth quarter to put the game out of reach. Jimmy Butler III had a near triple-double with 21 points, nine rebounds and seven assists. Will Richard added 15 points off the bench, while Quinten Post and Brandin Podziemski both scored 14 points.
contentExpanded.text: The Warriors outscored the Pacers 39-18 in the fourth quarter to put the game out of reach. Jimmy Butler III had a near triple-double with 21 points, nine rebounds and seven assists. Will Richard added 15 points off the bench, while Quinten Post and Brandin Podziemski both scored 14 points.

contentExpanded.html:
14-0 RUN
With the game tied at 65-65 later in the third quarter, the Warriors went on a 14-0 run in just over a three minute span during the end of third and beginning of the fourth quarter. The Pacers missed seven consecutive shots during the run, as the Warriors got scoring from five different players, highlighted by Moses Moody's 4-point play with 4.7 seconds remaining in the third quarter.
contentExpanded.text: 14-0 RUNWith the game tied at 65-65 later in the third quarter, the Warriors went on a 14-0 run in just over a three minute span during the end of third and beginning of the fourth quarter. The Pacers missed seven consecutive shots during the run, as the Warriors got scoring from five different players, highlighted by Moses Moody's 4-point play with 4.7 seconds remaining in the third quarter.

contentExpanded.html:
RICHARD'S FOURTH QUARTER SPARK
Will Richard scored 11 of his 15 points in the fourth quarter as the Warriors put the game out of reach. Richard was extremely effective in the frame, shooting 4-for-6 from the field. He was very active near the rim, first rejecting a screen and cutting to the hoop, with Jimmy Butler III finding him for a wide open lay-up. He then took Isaiah Jackson off the dribble and hit an 18-foot step-back jumper.

He was very active near the rim, first rejecting a screen and cutting to the hoop, with Jimmy Butler III finding him for a wide open lay-up. He then took Isaiah Jackson off the dribble and hit an 18-foot step-back jumper.

contentExpanded.html: "Just being so insightful," Richard said of how his teammates have helped him adjust to the NBA. "I feel like I ask them a lot of questions about where they like to be on the court, where I fit in, and stuff like that. All of them have been helpful telling me exactly where to go and stuff like that. So I’ll probably just say the way they've guided me throughout my transition to the NBA."

contentExpanded.html: "I think it’s a balance of being aggressive and making sure that everybody gets their shots," Butler III said postgame about his play when Stephen Curry is out of the lineup. "I love making sure that guys are getting their open shots, making sure their confidence is going early. Then when it’s time to score I think I can do that with the best of them honestly. But before any and all that stuff I just think our pace was great, we were spaced incredibly well tonight on offense, so it looked a lot better."

HORFORD FINDS HIS SHOT
After an 0-for-7 shooting performance in his last game, Al Horford rebounded in a big way. The veteran center knocked down a season-high four 3-pointers in 18 minutes of action.
contentExpanded.text: HORFORD FINDS HIS SHOTAfter an 0-for-7 shooting performance in his last game, Al Horford rebounded in a big way. The veteran center knocked down a season-high four 3-pointers in 18 minutes of action.

contentExpanded.html:
• The Warriors won their fifth consecutive home game and have not lost at Chase Center this season... The last time the Warriors began a season winning five-straight home contests was the 2018-19 season when they opened the season with six consecutive home victories.
  • Tonight’s win snapped a four-game losing streak to Indiana (home and road) and a six-game losing streak to the Pacers at Chase Center… Entering tonight’s contest, the Pacers had never lost at Chase Center (6-0).
  • The two teams split the 2025-26 season series, 1-1… According to the Elias Sports Bureau, this is the fifth-fewest games into a campaign that the Warriors have completed a season series vs. an opponent (the record is six games, during the 2005-06 season, against the Knicks)… For the Pacers, this is the second fewest games (10) for them to finish playing an opponent in a single season (nine, twice). 
  • The Warriors held the Pacers to 83 points, the second fewest they have allowed to an opponent this season (79, 10/28/25 vs. LAC)… The 83 points scored matched the fewest points Warriors have allowed to the Pacers in a contest all-time (3/5/99).
  • Golden State’s 31-point margin of victory was the highest this season (prev. 19, 98-79 on 10/28/25 vs. LAC) and the largest since a 38-point win on 4/8/25 at PHX (133-95)… The last time the Warriors won a home game by that margin was on 2/25/25 vs. CHA (128-92)… The 31-point win also marked the team’s largest win in a game without Stephen Curry since he entered the league in 2009-10 (ESPN). 
  • The Warriors turned the ball over 10 times, the second-fewest in a game this season (nine on 10/23/25 vs. DEN)… Golden State improved to 4-0 when recording fewer turnovers than the team’s opponent this season (IND – 22). 
  • For the second time this season the Warriors had six players score in double figures (other instance was on 10/23/25 vs. DEN).
  • For the sixth time this season the Warriors recorded at least 10 steals (11 tonight). Their record in those contests is 4-2.
  • Tonight marked the Warriors’ 570th consecutive sellout, the second-longest active streak in the NBA and the sixth-longest all-time. 
  • Jimmy Butler III recorded a game-high 21 points, team-high nine rebounds, team-high seven assists, two steals and one block… It was Butler III’s seventh 20-point game of the current campaign, and second this season against the Pacers (20 on 11/1/25 at IND).
  • Will Richard tallied 15 points off the bench, his third consecutive game scoring in double figures (averaging 19.0 ppg in that span)… His seven made free throws are the most for a Warriors rookie since Jonathan Kuminga made seven on 3/28/22 at MEM.
  • Al Horford grabbed four rebounds, moving him with into a tie for 58thplace on the NBA all-time rebounds list (Larry Bird, 8,974 career rebounds)… Horford made all four of his 3-point attempts to finish with 12 points, his second game scoring 10-or-more points this season. 
  • Jonathan Kuminga grabbed eight rebounds, extending his career-best rebounding streak of five-or-more to 10 consecutive games.
  • Quinten Post recorded a season-high tying 14 points (third time) and season-high tying eight rebounds (10/28 vs. LAC) in his sixth start of the season.  
  • Stephen Curry missed his third consecutive game with an illness (the Warriors are 1-2 in games he has missed this season)… Since 2014-15, the Warriors are 75-113 (.399) without Curry in the lineup.

contentStructured.html: Six Warriors scored in double figures as the Golden State Warriors defeated the Indiana Pacers 114-83 at Chase Center on Sunday night.
contentStructured.text: Six Warriors scored in double figures as the Golden State Warriors defeated the Indiana Pacers 114-83 at Chase Center on Sunday night.

contentStructured.html: The Warriors outscored the Pacers 39-18 in the fourth quarter to put the game out of reach. Jimmy Butler III had a near triple-double with 21 points, nine rebounds and seven assists. Will Richard added 15 points off the bench, while Quinten Post and Brandin Podziemski both scored 14 points.
contentStructured.text: The Warriors outscored the Pacers 39-18 in the fourth quarter to put the game out of reach. Jimmy Butler III had a near triple-double with 21 points, nine rebounds and seven assists. Will Richard added 15 points off the bench, while Quinten Post and Brandin Podziemski both scored 14 points.

contentStructured.html:
14-0 RUN
With the game tied at 65-65 later in the third quarter, the Warriors went on a 14-0 run in just over a three minute span during the end of third and beginning of the fourth quarter. The Pacers missed seven consecutive shots during the run, as the Warriors got scoring from five different players, highlighted by Moses Moody's 4-point play with 4.7 seconds remaining in the third quarter.
contentStructured.text: 14-0 RUNWith the game tied at 65-65 later in the third quarter, the Warriors went on a 14-0 run in just over a three minute span during the end of third and beginning of the fourth quarter. The Pacers missed seven consecutive shots during the run, as the Warriors got scoring from five different players, highlighted by Moses Moody's 4-point play with 4.7 seconds remaining in the third quarter.

contentStructured.html:
RICHARD'S FOURTH QUARTER SPARK
Will Richard scored 11 of his 15 points in the fourth quarter as the Warriors put the game out of reach. Richard was extremely effective in the frame, shooting 4-for-6 from the field. He was very active near the rim, first rejecting a screen and cutting to the hoop, with Jimmy Butler III finding him for a wide open lay-up. He then took Isaiah Jackson off the dribble and hit an 18-foot step-back jumper.

Richard was extremely effective in the frame, shooting 4-for-6 from the field. He was very active near the rim, first rejecting a screen and cutting to the hoop, with Jimmy Butler III finding him for a wide open lay-up. He then took Isaiah Jackson off the dribble and hit an 18-foot step-back jumper.

contentStructured.html: "Just being so insightful," Richard said of how his teammates have helped him adjust to the NBA. "I feel like I ask them a lot of questions about where they like to be on the court, where I fit in, and stuff like that. All of them have been helpful telling me exactly where to go and stuff like that. So I’ll probably just say the way they've guided me throughout my transition to the NBA."

"I feel like I ask them a lot of questions about where they like to be on the court, where I fit in, and stuff like that. All of them have been helpful telling me exactly where to go and stuff like that. So I’ll probably just say the way they've guided me throughout my transition to the NBA."

contentStructured.html:
JIMMY LEADS THE SCORING
Jimmy Butler III scored a team-high 21 points in the victory, shooting 10-for-15 from the field. Butler III filled the box score, also adding nine rebounds, seven assists, two steals and a block.
contentStructured.text: JIMMY LEADS THE SCORINGJimmy Butler III scored a team-high 21 points in the victory, shooting 10-for-15 from the field. Butler III filled the box score, also adding nine rebounds, seven assists, two steals and a block.

contentStructured.html: "I think it’s a balance of being aggressive and making sure that everybody gets their shots," Butler III said postgame about his play when Stephen Curry is out of the lineup. "I love making sure that guys are getting their open shots, making sure their confidence is going early. Then when it’s time to score I think I can do that with the best of them honestly. But before any and all that stuff I just think our pace was great, we were spaced incredibly well tonight on offense, so it looked a lot better."

But before any and all that stuff I just think our pace was great, we were spaced incredibly well tonight on offense, so it looked a lot better."

contentStructured.html:
POST'S EARLY START
Quinten Post got the start at center for his sixth start of the season, and made an early imprint on the contest. Post hit a pair of catch-and-shoot triples to give the Warriors an early lead.

contentStructured.html: Post finished the game with 14 points, tying his season-high, shooting 4-for-10 from the field, and adding eight rebounds.
contentStructured.text: Post finished the game with 14 points, tying his season-high, shooting 4-for-10 from the field, and adding eight rebounds.

contentStructured.html: "I like Quinten out there with that first group," Steve Kerr said postgame. "He’s played really well, his defense has dramatically improved. I think he’s second on our team in plus/minus. He gives us that shooter feel, quick ball mover, all of that stuff."

HORFORD FINDS HIS SHOT
After an 0-for-7 shooting performance in his last game, Al Horford rebounded in a big way. The veteran center knocked down a season-high four 3-pointers in 18 minutes of action.
